recipeIngredient: 800 g boneless chicken thighs (skinless, cut into bite-sized pieces)
10 g fresh, crushed or minced ginger
5 g Kashmiri chili (or 2.5 g ground red chili powder)
2 small onions (or 1 large onion, finely diced)
5 g Kashmiri chili (optional for color and flavor)
2 g red chili powder (adjust to your taste preference)
315 ml heavy or thickened cream (use evaporated milk for lower calories)

text.content: Combine chicken with all marinade ingredients in a bowl. Marinate for 10 minutes to an hour (or overnight).
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Sear chicken in batches for 3 minutes per side until browned. Set aside and keep warm.
Melt butter in the same pan. Saut√© onions until soft (about 3 minutes), scraping up browned bits. Add garlic, ginger, and spices; fry for 20 seconds.
Pour in tomato puree, chili powders, and salt. Simmer for 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the sauce thickens and deepens in color.
Stir cream and sugar into the sauce. Add chicken and its juices back to the pan. Cook for 8-10 minutes until chicken is cooked through and sauce is thick. Add water if needed to thin.
Garnish with fresh coriander. Serve hot with garlic butter rice and homemade Naan bread.
